module.p: dìcheall diligence, effort, application is a masculine simple common noun, with genitive singular form dìchill.

Examples from modern usage –
’S e Tòmas an aon chroitear as aithne dhomh a dh’èirich gu inbhe taidhcùn. Rinn e sin tro dhìcheall, obair chruaidh agus tàlant malairt a bha neo-ghnàthach. An-diugh tha iomadh companaidh na ainm air feadh na Gàidhealtachd. [...]
Thomas is the only crofter I know who has risen to the status of a tycoon. He did that through diligence, hard work and a talent for business that was unusual. Today there are many companies in his name all over the Highlands. [...] td. 5

Pedagogical examples –
Rinn mi mo dhìcheall (air ...)
I did my best (to ...) td. 147
dìcheallach diligent, hardworking, conscientious is a derived adjective from the noun dìcheall created with the suffix -(e)ach.
